gw.plugin.policyperiod

Interface IPolicyTermPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IPolicyTermPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin used to calculate period end dates based on term types, and to calculate term types based on period start and end dates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Date calculatePeriodEnd(java.util.Date effDate, TermType termType, PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
      Given the effective date, the term for a PolicyPeriod, and the PolicyPeriod, return the default expiration date.
      java.util.Date calculatePeriodEndFromBasedOn(java.util.Date effDate, TermType termType, PolicyPeriod basedOnPolicyPeriod, boolean shouldPerformDateReconciliation)
      Given the effective date, the term for a PolicyPeriod, and the basedOn PolicyPeriod, return the default expiration date.
      TermType calculatePolicyTerm(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod, java.util.Date periodStart, java.util.Date periodEnd)
      Given a policy period and a set of period dates calculates the policy term.

    • Method Detail

      • calculatePeriodEnd

        java.util.Date calculatePeriodEnd(java.util.Date effDate,
                                  TermType termType,
                                  PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
        Given the effective date, the term for a PolicyPeriod, and the PolicyPeriod, return the default expiration date. This should always return a non-null date.
        Parameters:
        effDate - the policy period effective or start date
        termType - the policy period term
        policyPeriod - the policy period

        Implementation Note: Called from Java. Every TermType should be mentioned, and the period expiration date must be set. The time part of the returned expiration date will be ignored, in favor of the existing expiration time (as set by the effective time plugin).

        Returns:
        The calculated period end date

      • calculatePeriodEndFromBasedOn

        java.util.Date calculatePeriodEndFromBasedOn(java.util.Date effDate,
                                             TermType termType,
                                             PolicyPeriod basedOnPolicyPeriod,
                                             boolean shouldPerformDateReconciliation)
        Given the effective date, the term for a PolicyPeriod, and the basedOn PolicyPeriod, return the default expiration date. This should always return a non-null date.
        Parameters:
        effDate - the policy period effective or start date
        termType - the policy period term
        basedOnPolicyPeriod - the basedOn policy period
        shouldPerformDateReconciliation - whether to perform date reconciliation

        Implementation Note: Called from Java. Every TermType should be mentioned, and the period expiration date must be set. The time part of the returned expiration date will be ignored, in favor of the existing expiration time (as set by the effective time plugin).

        Returns:
        The calculated period end date

      • calculatePolicyTerm

        TermType calculatePolicyTerm(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod,
                             java.util.Date periodStart,
                             java.util.Date periodEnd)
        Given a policy period and a set of period dates calculates the policy term.
        Parameters:
        policyPeriod - The PolicyPeriod for which the term is to be calculated
        periodStart - The policy period start
        periodEnd - The policy period end
        Returns:
        The calculated TermType
